Table 14. Number of deaths and mortality rate per 100,000 local jail inmates, by hold status, 2014–19

column4: Sum of annual average daily populations, 2014–19
column5: Mortality rate per 100,000 local jail inmates, by hold status, 2014–19

column1: Note: Average daily population was calculated for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, the U.S. Marshals Service, and other authorities based on the proportion of the confined population on December 31.
a/Includes contractual, temporary, courtesy, or ad hoc holds for federal, local, or state authorities. A jail inmate may have multiple hold statuses.
b/Includes state or federal prison, the Bureau of Indian Affairs, or any other jail jurisdiction.
c/Persons held in jail for local law enforcement and court officials, not on behalf of state or federal officials.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Mortality in Correctional Institutions, 2014–19.
